column2: Who said, "Let there be light"?
Who said, "The woman you put here with me she gave me some fruit from the tree, and I ate it"?
Who said, "Look, I'm dying of starvation!... What good is my birthright to me now?"
Who said, "I am the light of the world."
Who said, "I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me."
Who said, "Am I my brother's keeper?"
Who said, "Don't ask me to leave you and turn back. I will go wherever you go and live wherever you live. Your people will be my people, and your God will be my God."
Who said, "I have been going back and forth across the earth, watching everything that’s going on"
Who said, "We must obey God rather than human authority"
Who said, "Therefore I tell you, whatever you ask for in prayer, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours."
Who said, "The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding."
Who said, "Blessed are the pure in heart, for they will see God."
Who said, "I have told you these things, so that in me you may have peace. In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world."
Who said, "Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moths and vermin destroy, and where thieves break in and steal. But store up for yourselves treasures in heaven."
Who said, "Speak, for your servant is listening"
Who said, "My God sent his angel to the lions' mouths so that they would not hurt me."
Who said, "The voice is the voice of Jacob, but the hands are the hands of Esau"
Who said, "The Lord will fight for you; you need only to be still."
Who said, "The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want."
Who said, "I can do all this through him who gives me strength."
Who said, "Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God."
Who said, "Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or terrified because of them, for the Lord your God goes with you; he will never leave you nor forsake you."
Who said, "For where two or three gather in my name, there am I with them."
Who said, "Everything I heard in my country about your achievements and wisdom is true!... Truly I had not heard the half of it! Your wisdom is far greater than what I was told"
Who said, "Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight."
Who said, "But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint."
Who said, "And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose."
Who said, "Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good."
Who said, "You rebuke the arrogant, who are accursed, those who stray from your commands."
Who said, "God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble."
Who said, "Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you face trials of many kinds, because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance."
Who said, "A cheerful heart is good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones."
